newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Eastman to complete Malaysian plant early.
newsitem.headline: Eastman to complete Malaysian plant early.

text.p: Construction of U.S.-based Eastman Chemical Company's copolyester plant in Malaysia is expected to be completed by November 1997, the national Bernama news agency reported on Tuesday.
"Construction is about 20 percent complete, and the plant is scheduled to be on-stream in early 1998," Bernama quoted Wayne Burchette, the project's engineering and construction manager as saying.
In a statement issued by the company in Kuala Lumpur, Burchette said the engineering, drafting and procurement activities for the plant were nearly complete.
One of the plastics to be produced at the plant, Spectar copolyester, is being marketed as a replacement for acrylic and polycarbonate sheets, Bernama said.
Sheets made from Spectar are used in signs and architectural products, said the agency.
-- Kuala Lumpur newsroom (603-201 4813) REUTER AZI BXT
